message_1: A set A contains 10 elements and set B contains 15 elements. How many elements will there be in the intersection of sets A and B if there are 5 elements common to both sets A and B?
message_2: If there are 5 elements common to both sets A and B, then the intersection of sets A and B will contain those 5 elements. Therefore, there will be 5 elements in the intersection of sets A and B.
